newsitem.title: USA: CBS TV president Lund resigns - source.
newsitem.headline: CBS TV president Lund resigns - source.

text.p: Peter Lund, the president of Westinghouse Electric Corp's CBS television unit, has resigned, according to a source at CBS.
Lund told Westinghouse's chairman Michael Jordan he was resigning earlier this week, according to the source.

The resignation occurred after Lund was informed by Jordan that he would no longer oversee the television stations division, the source said. Jordan had told Lund that he was reorganizing the unit, and that Mel Karmazin, the head of its radio unit, would run the 14 CBS stations.
CBS declined comment on the resignation.
Word of the resignation leaked out at a CBS party at Tavern on the Green Thursday afternoon here after CBS formally presented its new fall television primetime lineup.
